intro: Batratherum molle var. parvulum, commonly known as the small-leaved batratherum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and a fibrous root system, making it suitable for ornamental use in shaded garden settings. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
